review.title: “Internship”
review.pros: Pros – Freedom and relaxing. Great place to start your career as a recent college grad.
review.cons: Cons – Don't have me sit in on meetings. I feel clueless sometimes of what is going on when given some pretty important work.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Get a consulting firm to brand the company.

review.title: “High employee turnover, company not giving out yearly raises, some employees have more than one position.”
review.pros: Pros – Flexible schedule, some nice people.
review.cons: Cons – No chance to grow or expand your career. Executives are micro-managers. High turnover in key executive positions. Lunch is okay, microwaves, but no actual food is served. Outdoor basketball court. Close to a Starbucks, Costco, and Mcdonalds if you want coffee, lunch, or run errands.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Take a stronger leadership position. Post positions so that every employee has a chance to interview instead of "handpicking" an employee and giving them the job and shutting everyone else out. Hire qualified people instead of new college grads with no business experience.

review.title: “If you want excitement and a dynamic environment, this is not the place (US Office)”
review.pros: Pros – Quiet... not much to do...
review.cons: Cons – Quiet... not much to do... this is a chinese company... it's ran like a chinese labor farm... the US office is pretty much a shipping warehouse and translation factory and human interface/support to US customers... don't expect any groundbreaking technological advances or any actual product development, that all happens in Asia... the US has no actual effect on the direction of the company...
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Keep up the good work

review.title: “Good place for low to mid level career”
review.pros: Pros – Flexible work conditions, comprehensive product line at the mow to mid range target audience
review.cons: Cons – salary is lower than the competition. Some micromanagement
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Pay people based on the competitive environment

review.title: “Great People!”
review.pros: Pros – D-Link has hired great enthusiastic people to work with. The culture is very laid back but there is a lot going on. Opportunities for interns to step and get noticed are plenty if you ask. They are very laid back for days off and PTO.
review.cons: Cons – Not too much of a social environmentThere is so much red tape it takes forever for something to be approved
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Shift the focus to customer based rather than product based.

review.title: “Friendly environment, but not a place for young talent or ambitious employees”
review.pros: Pros – Casual environment, flat organizational structure makes it easy for executives and other employees to communicate well. Employees are encouraged to innovate. Hours are flexible and there is a basketball court with regular games.
review.cons: Cons – Comparatively low pay with nonexistent performance-based rewards. Many useless meetings with too much politics not enough emphasis on results or accountability.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Stop having using meetings, project manager is desperately needed, focus on accountability and reward those who perform well. Match marketing and technology trends in the market.

review.title: “Ignored”
review.pros: Pros – They have a basketball court and these mexican taco trucks that come for lunch. They left me alone for the most part and I didn't have anything to do. So I don't know about the work there.
review.cons: Cons – They pretty much put me in front of a computer and ignored me. Pay was a bit low as well.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Restructuring”
review.pros: Pros – Company went through some restructuring and is emerging from its dark times. Executive management has started HR initiatives to boost employee morale. Company goals have become clear from top down. I've personally gotten along with all international employees, executive management, upper management, co-workers, and interns. There is plenty of work to get you through the day. There are/is a basketball court, showers, and a ping pong table. The US building is going through restructuring to further improve working conditions. Marketing department was a collaborative environment and truly a pleasure to work in. Convenient location. Changes also allowed access to new technology - I was given a new laptop and software. The D-Link Boxee Box has become a media center in my home.
review.cons: Cons – No improvement without growing pains. There is constant bickering/politics at the top with no moderation/solution by executives. Workload seems to be dumped unevenly into specific departments. Roles have not clearly been defined yet. Company is very top heavy with few middle class workers. Pay is on the low side (after negotiations). Employees were kept after hours to meet with Taiwan executives. There were a LOT of meaningless hour long meetings.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Identify the workhorses vs. the complainers. Reward the workhorses and deal with the complainers. Plan for the future better and more quickly. Stop meeting so much and hire a project manager. I've come out of 9/10 meetings feeling like nothing has been accomplished. There was a lot of talk and not enough doing. Executives need to give deadlines and hold the owner accountable.

review.title: “Waste of my time”
review.pros: Pros – monthly ice cream and cake for birthdays
review.cons: Cons – Condescending management who have cronies. Turnover high and they promote incompetent people to important positions.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Recognize talented people and let them shine. Don't hire competent peoples and then be prejudiced against them so they eventually leave.

review.title: “D-Link”
review.pros: Pros – It's a good place to work for if you are a fresh college graduate. It offers a great place to learn and accumulate work experience.For sales, it's a good place to work for if you can deliver the numbers
review.cons: Cons – . No work performance review from the top management.. Pay was bad in comparison to other high tech industry.. The executives had inadequate knowledge or expertise in some areas in the market and consequently provided little or no leadership.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Take the initiative to learn and lead instead of waiting for someone to feed you the info

review.title: “Dissatisfied-Linking”
review.pros: Pros – Work here for personal growth.
review.cons: Cons – Outdated software and system, long hours, crappy benefits, no company culture and teamwork. There is no room for growth. A lot of finger pointing when mistake arises.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Learn how to manage and treat people and dont act like you know it all.

review.title: “OK Environment to work. Good environment to learn. But, stagnated growth.”
review.pros: Pros – Open Environment, great supervisors, good colleagues..
review.cons: Cons – No career OR learning opportunities....
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “A good company for people don't look for challenges.”

review.cons: Cons – Politics, not look for any new changes
review.advice-to-management: No, I would not recommend this company to a friend – I'm not optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “If you want to work with networking - try Cisco or Netgear”
review.pros: Pros – - Interesting products- Be part of building a connected world- Learn anything/everything about B2C and B2B networking- Some smart/friendly colleagues
review.cons: Cons – - A lot of overtime- Low salaries- Very poor management- People stay a year or two and then move on (unless you are top exec that have a high salary for doing very little)- Sexual harassment and verbal abuse towards women- Working hard does not mean you get a better salary or position at the company
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – - Be firm, stick to what you say - don't change directions on a monthly basis- Screaming has never been a good way of making people motivated (yes it's happens often in big European meetings)- Make sure to reward people that work hard

review.title: “Sales and Marketing Manager”
review.pros: Pros – Targets are achievableA good place to learn
review.cons: Cons – lacks employee empowerment environmentDoes not have a good reporting structureRelationship between management and subordinate is non existence
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Managers should create standards and give people clear expectations so they know what they are supposed to do, and wonder why they fail.

review.title: “The products D-Link made are all easy configure and stable”
